title: Arsenal news: Mesut Ozil let down by team-mates, says Rio Ferdinand | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 1:53 pm Time to cut Mesut Ozil some slack? (Picture: Getty) 
Mesut Ozil is not to blame for his poor recent form in an Arsenal shirt as his team-mates have not done enough to support him, says Manchester United legend Rio Ferdinand. 
The Germany international is often one of the first players to receive criticism when Arsenal as a whole go through a tough spell, but Ferdinand believes that is unfair. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
Arsenal may rely a great deal on their record signing to produce his magic week in, week out, but Ferdinand feels there’s not a lot he can do to make an impact if he doesn’t have runners around him. 
Ozil is known for his creative ability rather than for taking games by the scruff of a neck or producing an all-action display at both ends of the pitch, so his team-mates have been called on to give him more options when he’s on the ball. Ozil will be hoping to help Arsenal to a win against Bayern Munich (Picture: Getty) 
‘Mesut Ozil has become an easy scapegoat when things are going wrong at Arsenal. It’s not fair and it’s not right,’ Ferdinand wrote in the London Evening Standard . 
‘It’s true that he has gone off the boil of late and Arsenal do need him to step up in what is an enormous game but, barring Alexis Sanchez, you could say the same about all of the players. Arsenal fixtures
